    • Method Detail

      • ChainForwardUntil

        public static AnchorChain ChainForwardUntil​(Anchor start,
                                            List<String> preferLayerIds,
                                            Predicate<Annotation> follow,
                                            Predicate<Anchor> boundary)
        Creates a chain of anchors from the given anchor forwards through the graph, until the given condition is met, preferring paths through the given layer IDs (in order).
        Parameters:
        start - Start from this anchor and traverse forward through the graph.
        preferLayerIds - Layer IDs of layers to traverse through preferentially. These will be tried in order first, looking for a path. If not path is found, other layers will be traversed.
        follow - Traverse annotations that meet this condition - i.e. ignore linking annotations where follow.test(annotation) returns false.
        boundary - Stop when an anchor meets this condition - i.e. when boundary.test(anchor) returns true. This anchor will be returned as part of the chain. Can be null.
        Returns:
        A chain of anchors from the given anchor (which is excluded) until the anchor that met the given boundary condition (which is included).

      • ChainBackwardUntil

        public static AnchorChain ChainBackwardUntil​(Anchor start,
                                             List<String> preferLayerIds,
                                             Predicate<Annotation> follow,
                                             Predicate<Anchor> boundary)
        Creates a chain of anchors from the given anchor backwards through the graph, until the given condition is met, preferring paths through the given layer IDs (in order).
        Parameters:
        start - Start from this anchor and traverse backward through the graph.
        preferLayerIds - Layer IDs of layers to traverse through preferentially. These will be tried in order first, looking for a path. If not path is found, other layers will be traversed.
        follow - Follow annotations that meet this condition - i.e. ignore linking annotations where follow.test(annotation) returns false.
        boundary - Stop when an anchor meets this condition - i.e. when boundary.test(anchor) returns true. This anchor will be returned as part of the chain.
        Returns:
        A chain of anchors from the given anchor (which is excluded) until the anchor that met the given boundary condition (which is included).
